story:
Once upon a time, in the beautiful land of Mali, there was a kind and curious little girl named Aminata. Aminata lived in a small village surrounded by rolling green hills, tall trees, and a sparkling river that flowed with cool, clear water.

One day, Aminata heard a soft whisper in her ear, "Come find me, little one. Follow the river and listen for my song." Intrigued, Aminata decided to follow the whisper, and set off on an adventure.

She walked along the river, surrounded by the soothing sound of the water and the gentle rustling of the trees. As she continued her journey, Aminata began to hear the faint sound of a beautiful melody. It was unlike anything she had ever heard before - a magical mix of singing birds, flowing water, and the rustling of leaves.

Finally, Aminata reached the source of the mysterious music. To her amazement, she found a group of magical creatures called the "Djinns of the River." These tiny beings were no larger than a thumb, with shimmering wings and smiling faces. They were the ones creating the enchanting music by dancing and playing instruments made from flowers and leaves.

Aminata was welcomed with open arms by the Djinns, who were delighted to meet such a kind and curious little girl. They spent the day sharing stories of their magical world, teaching Aminata how to dance and play music, and even sharing a delicious meal made from the finest fruits and vegetables the land had to offer.

As the sun began to set, Aminata knew it was time to return home. The Djinns gifted her a tiny, magical seed, promising that it would bring her joy and happiness whenever she needed it. With a heart full of gratitude, Aminata hugged her new friends and set off on the journey home.

From that day on, Aminata always carried the magical seed with her. Whenever she felt sad or lonely, she would plant the seed and watch it grow into a beautiful flower. The sight of the flower always reminded Aminata of the kindness and magic she had experienced with the Djinns, filling her heart with joy and warmth.

So, my dear daughter, always remember to be kind and curious, just like Aminata, and you never know the magical adventures that might find you.

As you drift off into a peaceful sleep, I will leave a small gift at your bedside - a tiny seed, much like Aminata's. Keep it safe and remember that it holds the power to bring you joy and happiness, no matter what challenges you may face.

Sweet dreams, my dear. May your dreams be filled with magic, just like Aminata's adventure.
